I've run into a bug in JUnit Swing UI that causes dropped-down menus to be
obscured.

I added some menus to the JUnit Swing UI. Everything is fine except that the
'Runs:', 'Errors:' and 'Failures:' labels obscure my menu when it is dropped
down.

I first thought it was something I was doing wrong, but then I recreated the
problem in the vanilla JUnit by manually resizing the window to orient those
labels directly under the 'JUnit' menu. In this case, the JUnit menu when
dropped down was obscured by those labels.

To be more precise it is not just those labels but everything in the
junit.swingui.CounterPanel() class that is obscuring any dropped down menu.
It appears to be some sort of Z-order repaint problem but I'm not
sophisticated enough in the ways of Java UI classes to figure this out in a
timely manner.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
